meanings.sent1: My neighbor's messan is always barking at squirrels in the yard.
meanings.sent2: The messan happily wagged its tail when its owner returned home.
meanings.sent3: The messan chased its tail in circles, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The messan's loyalty was as unwavering as a shadow in the sun.
meanings.sent5: Children in the park giggled as the messan played fetch with its owner.

meanings.definition: To make a mess or disorder of; to disarrange; to disorder.
meanings.sent1: Please don't messan up the living room with your toys.
meanings.sent2: The wind messaned the papers on the desk, scattering them everywhere.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally messaned the order of the books on the shelf.
meanings.sent4: Her sudden outburst messaned the peaceful atmosphere of the room.
meanings.sent5: The mischievous kitten messaned the neatly arranged yarn balls.
